prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism Face 1 Begin by creating a new coordinate system for the base of the prism. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.5, 0.0]. This will position the base of the prism 0.5 units above the X-Y plane. Create a face for the base of the prism. On the face, create a loop (loop\\_1) for the perimeter of the base. Within loop\\_1, create 5 line segments (line\\_1 through line\\_5) to define the shape of the base. The lines should be defined by the following start and end points, measured in units along the X and Y axes: * line\\_1: [0.0, 0.0], [0.5, 0.0] * line\\_2: [0.5, 0.0], [0.5, 0.25] * line\\_3: [0.5, 0.25], [0.25, 0.625] * line\\_4: [0.25, 0.625], [0.0, 0.625] * line\\_5: [0.0, 0.625], [0.0, 0.0] Face 2 Create a new face (face\\_2) for the side of the prism. On face\\_2, create a loop (loop\\_1) for the perimeter of the side. Within loop\\_1, create 4 line segments (line\\_1 through line\\_4) to define the shape of the side. The lines should be defined by the following start and end points, measured in units along the X and Y axes: * line\\_1: [0.5, 0.0], [0.75, 0.0] * line\\_2: [0.75, 0.0], [0.75, 0.25] * line\\_3: [0.75, 0.25], [0.5, 0.25] * line\\_4: [0.5, 0.25], [0.5, 0.0] Next, scale the entire sketch by a factor of 0.75. Extrude the base sketch by 0.5 units in the direction of the Z axis (normal). This will result in a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, a curved side, and a straight side. The height of the prism is 0.75 units, the length is 0.75 units, and the width is 0.5 units.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.5,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.5,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.0],"End Point":[0.5,0.25]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.25],"End Point":[0.25,0.625]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.25,0.625],"End Point":[0.0,0.625]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.625],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}},"face_2":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.25]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.25],"End Point":[0.5,0.25]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.25],"End Point":[0.5,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.5,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Create the base of the cylindrical object 1. Define a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. 2. Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. 3. Draw a circle with a center at (0.375, 0.375) and a radius of 0.375. 4. Scale the 2D sketch by 0.75. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch with a 0.075 extrusion depth towards the normal and no extrusion opposite the normal. Use the coordinate system defined earlier. 6. Extrude the 3D sketch to create a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered middle section. The object has a flat top and bottom. Part 2 Instructions Add a slightly tapered top and bottom to the cylindrical object 1. Define a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.075. 2. Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. 3. Draw a circle with a center at (0.375, 0.375) and a radius of 0.375. 4. Draw a smaller circle inside the first circle, with a center at (0.375, 0.375) and a radius of 0.3375. 5. Scale the 2D sketch by 0.75. 6. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch with a 0.675 extrusion depth towards the normal and no extrusion opposite the normal. Use the coordinate system defined earlier. 7. Extrude the 3D sketch to join the existing cylindrical object and create a slightly tapered top and bottom. The object has a flat base and a slightly curved top. The height of the object is approximately three times the width of the base. The object is symmetrical along its central axis. Part 3 Instructions Create a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom 1. Define a new coordinate system with euler angles of -90.0, 0.0, -90.0 and a translation vector of 0.375, 0.225, 0.4687. 2. Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. 3. Draw a rectangle with opposite corners at (0.0, 0.0) and (0.3, 0.2812). 4. Scale the 2D sketch by 0.3. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch with a 0.0 extrusion depth towards the normal and a 0.75 extrusion depth opposite the normal. Use the coordinate system defined earlier. 6. Cut the 3D sketch from the existing object to create a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 4 units by 6 units. Part 4 Instructions Create a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom and a curved side 1. Define a new coordinate system with euler angles of -90.0, 0.0, -90.0 and a translation vector of 0.375, 0.225, 0.4687. 2. Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. 3. Draw a rectangle with opposite corners at (0.0, 0.0) and (0.3, 0.2812). 4. Scale the 2D sketch by 0.3. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch with a 0.75 extrusion depth towards the normal and a 0.0 extrusion depth opposite the normal. Use the coordinate system defined earlier. 6. Cut the 3D sketch from the existing object to create a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom and a curved side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 1 unit in height. The prism is centered on a white background.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: A cylindrical object with a tapered end Create the coordinate system Start by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [ -90.0, 0.0, -90.0 ] * Translation Vector: [ 0.375, 0.0, 0.0 ] Create the 2D sketch Now, create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the newly created coordinate system and draw the following: * Face 1 + Loop 1 - Circle 1 * Center: [ 0.0135, 0.0135 ] * Radius: 0.0135 Scale and transform the 2D sketch Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.027 and transform it into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system specified earlier. Extrude the 3D sketch Finally, extrude the 3D sketch by a depth of 0.1875 towards the normal vector and 0.1875 in the opposite direction, resulting in the following dimensions of the final shape: * Length: 0.375 * Width: 0.027 * Height: 0.027 Part 2: A three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom Create the coordinate system Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [ 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 ] * Translation Vector: [ -0.015, 0.0135, 0.021 ] Create the 2D sketch Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the newly created coordinate system and draw the following: * Face 1 + Loop 1 - Line 1 * Start Point: [ 0.0, 0.0 ] * End Point: [ 0.075, 0.0 ] - Line 2 * Start Point: [ 0.075, 0.0 ] * End Point: [ 0.075, 0.0399 ] - Line 3 * Start Point: [ 0.075, 0.0399 ] * End Point: [ 0.0, 0.0399 ] - Line 4 * Start Point: [ 0.0, 0.0399 ] * End Point: [ 0.0, 0.0 ] Scale and transform the 2D sketch Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.075 and transform it into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system specified earlier. Extrude the 3D sketch Extrude the 3D sketch by a depth of 0.0225 in both directions along the normal vector, resulting in the following dimensions of the final shape: * Length: 0.075 * Width: 0.045 * Height: 0.075 Note: The last extrusion operation resulted in a subtractive feature to the previously constructed part.</description>

prompt: <description>**Intermediate Part 1: Three-dimensional Rectangular Prism** Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel to each other and meet at right angles. The prism is centered on a white background. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane. 3. Create a rectangle with four lines: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.45] * Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.45], End Point [0.0, 0.45] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.45], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis to generate the 3D model with a depth of 0.15 units. This will create the final rectangular prism shape. **Intermediate Part 2: Sloped Rectangular Prism** Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom that has a sloped side. The height is approximately twice the width. The length of the sides is equal. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 180.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.3188, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane. 3. Create a rectangle with four lines: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.1875] * Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.1875], End Point [0.0, 0.1875] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.1875], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis to generate the 3D model with a depth of approximately 0.0938 units. This will create a sloped side on the prism. Use a cut operation during extrusion. The resulting shape should match the final shape specified in the JSON.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: A rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole on one end Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1 with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.05, 0.0] Draw the first face of the prism, which consists of 4 lines with the following end points: * Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.0] * Line 2: [0.75, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.1] * Line 3: [0.75, 0.1] to [0.0, 0.1] * Line 4: [0.0, 0.1] to [0.0, 0.0] Add the following loops to the first face: * Loop 1: A closed loop made up of Line 1 and Line 4. * Loop 2: A circular loop with a center at [0.25, 0.05] and a radius of 0.015. * Loop 3: A circular loop with a center at [0.5, 0.05] and a radius of 0.0125. Extrude the first face of the prism by 0.025 units in both the normal and opposite directions of the normal, using a scaling factor of 0.75. Perform a "NewBodyFeatureOperation" to create the final shape. Part 2: A cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom Create a new coordinate system for part 2 with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [90.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0575, 0.0425] Draw a face containing a single loop, which consists of a circle with the following center and radius: * Center: [0.0075, 0.0075] * Radius: 0.0075 Extrude the face of the cylinder by 0.0226 units in both the normal and opposite directions of the normal, using a scaling factor of 0.015. Perform a "CutFeatureOperation" to subtract the cylinder from the previous part. The resulting shape is the final prism with two cylindrical holes on its front face, aligned vertically.</description>
